stem: A 25-year-old man with a three-day history of swelling and pain in his right knee joint develops right wrist joint involvement the next day. He's just returned from a trip to India. A physical examination reveals a temperature of 39 C, as well as swollen, tender joints. A 50cc sample of knee joint aspiration revealed septic arthritis with gram-negative cocci. Which of the following is the most probable organism responsible?
disc:
The disseminated gonococcal infection has two clinical syndromes.
- Tenosynovitis-dermatitis syndrome (a triad of oligoarthralgia, tenosynovitis, and dermatitis)
- Purulent arthritis syndrome without skin lesions

When the tenosynovitis dermatitis syndrome is untreated, it progresses to the latter which is characterized by supportive arthritis leading to pain, tender, swollen joints involving knees, wrists, and ankles. 

Cultures of blood and synovial fluids are essential. 

Patients with septic arthritis need 7-14 days of ceftriaxone with joint drainage.
